strategies.name: Accelerating Momentum
strategies.summary: Multi-period momentum with short-term emphasis.
strategies.description: Combines momentum across multiple timeframes (1M, 3M, 6M, 12M) with higher weights on recent periods. Captures accelerating trends where short-term momentum aligns with longer-term direction.

strategies.name: Kaufman Adaptive Moving Average
strategies.summary: Moving average that adapts to market efficiency.
strategies.description: Perry Kaufman's Adaptive Moving Average (KAMA). Uses Efficiency Ratio to dynamically adjust smoothing. Fast in trends, slow in chop. Reduces whipsaws compared to fixed MAs.

Indicators: Efficiency Ratio = |Price Change| / Sum of |Daily Changes|
Entry: Buy when Price > KAMA and KAMA rising

notes: Perry Kaufman's Trading Systems and Methods
Efficiency Ratio measures trend vs noise
ER = 1 means perfect trend, ER = 0 means pure noise

strategies.name: ADX Trend Filter
strategies.summary: Trade only when ADX confirms trend strength.
strategies.description: Uses ADX and DI to stay with strong trends and avoid chop.
notes: Long-only by default; set allow_short to enable shorts.

strategies.name: Aroon Indicator
strategies.summary: Trend strength using time since highs/lows.
strategies.description: Aroon indicator measures how long since the highest high and lowest low. Aroon Up > 70 with Aroon Down < 30 indicates strong uptrend. Captures trend emergence and strength.

Indicators: Aroon Up = ((Period - Days since highest high) / Period) * 100
Aroon Down = ((Period - Days since lowest low) / Period) * 100
Entry: Buy when Aroon Up > 70 and Aroon Down < 30
Exit: Sell when Aroon Up < 50 or Aroon Down > 50

notes: Name means 'dawn's early light' in Sanskrit
Measures trend strength and potential reversals

strategies.name: Asset Class Rotation
strategies.summary: Rotate into top-performing asset classes based on momentum.
strategies.description: Classic momentum rotation strategy. Ranks assets by recent returns and allocates to the strongest performers. Uses multi-timeframe momentum and absolute momentum filter.

Entry: 2. Select Top N with positive momentum
Exit: Monthly rebalance, drop assets with negative momentum

notes: Adapts sector rotation concept to asset classes
Can go to cash if no positive momentum assets

strategies.name: Bollinger-Keltner Squeeze
strategies.summary: Trade volatility expansion after squeeze.
strategies.description: When Bollinger Bands contract inside Keltner Channel, volatility is compressed (squeeze). When squeeze releases, trade in direction of momentum. Captures explosive moves.

Entry: Buy if momentum positive, sell if negative

notes: Squeeze duration indicates potential move size

strategies.name: Bollinger Band Reversion
strategies.summary: Buy at lower band, exit at middle band with bandwidth filter.
strategies.description: Classic mean reversion using Bollinger Bands. Enters long when price touches the lower band (oversold) and exits when price reverts to the middle band. Includes bandwidth filter to trade only during volatility expansion.

Entry: Buy when Close <= Lower Band and Bandwidth expanding
Risk controls: Stop loss at 3% below lower band

notes: Assumes ~95% of prices fall within 2 standard deviations
Best in sideways markets, underperforms in strong trends

strategies.name: CCI Mean Reversion
strategies.summary: Buy oversold CCI readings, exit at neutral.
strategies.description: Uses Commodity Channel Index to identify oversold conditions. Enters long when CCI falls below -100 (oversold) and exits when CCI returns to neutral (0). Includes max holding period and extreme stop.
notes: Constant 0.015 ensures ~70-80% of CCI values fall within [-100, +100]

strategies.name: Chandelier Exit
strategies.summary: ATR-based trailing stop trend system.
strategies.description: Uses ATR-based trailing stops from recent highs. Long stop = Highest High - 3*ATR. Stays in trend until volatility-adjusted stop is hit. Designed to ride trends and protect gains.

Indicators: ATR = Average True Range over N periods
Entry: Buy when price breaks above short stop (reversal)
Exit: Sell when price falls below long stop

notes: Named after chandelier hanging from ceiling (highest point)
Adapts to volatility - wider stops in volatile markets

strategies.name: Cointegration Basket
strategies.summary: Trade mean-reverting spread across multiple assets.
strategies.description: Constructs a stationary spread from multiple assets using rolling regression weights. The spread is tested for stationarity and traded when z-score reaches extremes. More robust than simple pairs trading.

Exit: Z crosses 0 or max hold reached

notes: Multi-asset spread more stable than pairs
Rolling weights adapt to changing relationships

strategies.name: Crisis Alpha
strategies.summary: Defensive exposure when volatility spikes.
strategies.description: Risk-off stance triggered by volatility regimes.

Logic: When VIX > threshold: long volatility proxy / cash

notes: Volatility trigger uses realized vol proxy on SPY.

strategies.name: Cross-Asset Momentum
strategies.summary: Use one asset's momentum to trade another.
strategies.description: Exploits lead-lag relationships between asset classes. Equity momentum can predict commodities; safe haven momentum signals risk appetite. Allocates based on cross-asset signals rather than own-asset momentum.
strategies.bestOn: Diverse asset pool with economic linkages

Entry: SPY momentum positive -> long risk assets

strategies.name: Cross-Sectional Momentum
strategies.summary: Buy winners and rotate monthly.
strategies.description: Rank assets by 12-month total return and hold the top names each month.

strategies.name: Donchian Breakout
strategies.summary: Ride multi-month highs and exit on fast lows.
strategies.description: A classic trend system that enters on 55-day highs and exits on 20-day lows with ATR sizing.

Entry: If close > DonchianHigh then enter long

strategies.name: Drawdown Control
strategies.summary: Reduce exposure when drawdown exceeds threshold.
strategies.description: Monitors portfolio drawdown in real-time. When drawdown exceeds threshold, reduces position proportionally. Similar to CPPI dynamic insurance. Can be used as overlay on any strategy.

Entry: Reduce by scale factor when drawdown exceeds

notes: May reduce returns in V-shaped recoveries
Similar to constant proportion portfolio insurance

strategies.name: Dual Momentum
strategies.summary: Combine relative and absolute momentum for asset selection.
strategies.description: Gary Antonacci's Dual Momentum: select the asset with highest relative momentum, then apply absolute momentum filter. If selected asset has negative momentum, switch to safe asset.

Entry: 1. Relative Momentum: Select asset with highest 12M return
2. Absolute Momentum: If selected return > 0, hold it
3. If selected return <= 0, hold safe asset (GLD)

notes: Uses GLD as safe asset proxy

strategies.name: Dual Moving Average
strategies.summary: Follow the 50/200 cross and stay aligned with regime.
strategies.description: A dual moving average system with a risk-off filter to avoid flat markets.

strategies.name: Dynamic Hedge Ratio Pairs
strategies.summary: Pairs trading with adaptive hedge ratio.
strategies.description: Uses Kalman Filter to dynamically estimate the hedge ratio between two assets. More adaptive than rolling OLS regression. Trades spread z-score with time-varying parameters.
strategies.bestOn: Cointegrated or highly correlated asset pairs

Entry: Z < -1.5: long spread (long Y, short X)
Position sizing: Equal dollar weights adjusted by hedge ratio

notes: Kalman Filter adapts to structural changes
No need for fixed lookback window

strategies.name: Faber TAA
strategies.summary: Hold assets above 10-month moving average, cash otherwise.
strategies.description: Meb Faber's Tactical Asset Allocation from 2007 paper. Simple rule: hold an asset only when price is above its 10-month (200-day) moving average. Equal weight across all assets in uptrend.

Position sizing: Equal weight across assets in uptrend
Risk controls: Full cash position when all assets below MA

strategies.name: Flight to Quality
strategies.summary: Switch to safe havens during equity stress.
strategies.description: Monitors equity market stress via drawdown and volatility. During normal times, holds risk assets. When stress indicators trigger, shifts allocation to safe haven assets like gold. Dynamic equity-to-safe-haven allocation.
notes: Fast exit from risk during stress

strategies.name: FX Carry
strategies.summary: Long high carry and rotate monthly.
strategies.description: Carry proxy ranking with monthly rebalance and volatility filter.
notes: Carry proxy uses 20d return ranking across the arena universe.

strategies.name: HMA Crossover
strategies.summary: Fast/slow Hull MA crossover for trend direction.
strategies.description: Low-lag Hull moving averages with optional long/short signals.
notes: Long-only by default; set allow_short to enable shorts.

strategies.name: HMM Regime Detection
strategies.summary: Use Hidden Markov Model to detect market regimes.
strategies.description: Hidden Markov Model identifies latent market states (bull/bear). Uses Gaussian emissions and Baum-Welch for parameter estimation. Trades based on inferred regime.

Entry: Buy when in bullish regime (higher mean state)

notes: Uses rolling window for regime detection
Bull regime = positive mean returns, Bear = negative

strategies.name: Hierarchical Risk Parity
strategies.summary: Risk parity using hierarchical clustering.
strategies.description: HRP by Marcos Lopez de Prado. Uses hierarchical clustering on correlation matrix to build a tree structure, then allocates weights recursively. Avoids covariance matrix inversion.
notes: Uses inverse variance at leaf level

strategies.name: Hurst-Filtered Mean Reversion
strategies.summary: Mean reversion only when Hurst exponent indicates mean-reverting regime.
strategies.description: Uses Hurst exponent to detect mean-reverting regimes (H < 0.5) before applying z-score mean reversion. Only trades when statistical evidence supports mean reversion, avoiding trend-following periods.
strategies.bestOn: Assets with alternating mean-reverting and trending regimes

strategies.name: Ichimoku Cloud
strategies.summary: Trade based on Ichimoku Cloud signals.
strategies.description: Ichimoku Kinko Hyo (One Glance Equilibrium Chart). Uses multiple lines to identify trend, momentum, and support/resistance. Price above cloud is bullish, below is bearish.

Indicators: Senkou Span A = (Tenkan + Kijun) / 2, shifted 26 days forward
Senkou Span B = (52-day high + 52-day low) / 2, shifted 26 days forward
Entry: Buy when price > Cloud AND Tenkan > Kijun
Strong signal if Chikou (lagging) also confirms
Exit: Price falls below Cloud OR Tenkan < Kijun

notes: Developed by Goichi Hosoda in 1930s Japan
Multiple confirmation signals reduce false entries

strategies.name: Kalman Filter Mean Reversion
strategies.summary: Trade deviations from Kalman-estimated fair value.
strategies.description: Uses Kalman Filter to dynamically estimate the 'fair value' of an asset. Enters long when price deviates significantly below the estimated value, expecting reversion. The filter adapts to changing market conditions.

Risk controls: Adaptive Q based on recent volatility

notes: Rudolf Kalman's 1960 optimal state estimation algorithm
Provides optimal linear estimate under Gaussian assumptions
Q/R ratio controls smoothness vs responsiveness tradeoff

strategies.name: Keltner Channel Breakout
strategies.summary: Breakouts from an ATR-based channel.
strategies.description: EMA midline with ATR bands; trades trigger on channel breaks.
notes: Long-only by default; set allow_short to enable shorts.

strategies.name: Low Volatility Rotation
strategies.summary: Defensive rotation into the lowest vol assets.
strategies.description: Ranks assets by realized volatility and holds the lowest-risk names monthly.

strategies.name: MACD + RSI Filter
strategies.summary: MACD crossover with RSI confirmation.
strategies.description: Combines MACD momentum signal with RSI filter. Only takes MACD buy signals when RSI is not overbought, and MACD sell signals when RSI is not oversold. Double confirmation reduces false signals.

strategies.name: MACD Strategy
strategies.summary: Classic MACD crossover trend following.
strategies.description: Uses MACD (Moving Average Convergence Divergence) line crossing the Signal line to identify trend changes. MACD above Signal indicates bullish momentum.

Entry: Buy when MACD crosses above Signal line
Exit: Sell when MACD crosses below Signal line

notes: Developed by Gerald Appel in the 1970s
Works best in trending markets, whipsaws in ranges

strategies.name: Money Flow Index Reversion
strategies.summary: Buy oversold MFI, exit at neutral.
strategies.description: Uses Money Flow Index (volume-weighted RSI) to identify oversold conditions. MFI < 20 indicates oversold with volume confirmation. Exit when MFI recovers to neutral.

Indicators: Raw Money Flow = Typical Price * Volume

notes: Combines price and volume for stronger signals
More reliable than pure price oscillators

strategies.name: Minimum Variance
strategies.summary: Minimize portfolio variance without return forecasts.
strategies.description: Minimum Variance portfolio minimizes total portfolio risk (variance) without requiring return predictions. Only uses the covariance matrix for optimization.

Entry: Solve min w'Σw s.t. sum(w)=1, w>=0

notes: Often outperforms due to low volatility anomaly
Tends to concentrate in low-vol assets

strategies.name: Momentum Crash Protection
strategies.summary: Momentum with drawdown-based position scaling.
strategies.description: Follows momentum but monitors the momentum factor's own drawdown. When momentum is experiencing a crash (reversal), reduces position size to protect against momentum crashes that historically cause severe losses.
notes: Momentum crashes are rare but severe

strategies.name: Multi-Factor Composite
strategies.summary: Combine value, momentum, and quality factors.
strategies.description: Ranks assets across multiple factors: Value (price relative to long-term average), Momentum (recent returns), and Quality (low volatility, low drawdown). Combines factor scores with configurable weights to select top-ranked assets.
strategies.bestOn: Diverse asset pool for factor diversification

Entry: Allocate to assets with highest composite score
Exit: Monthly rebalance based on updated scores

notes: Momentum tends to be strongest factor

strategies.name: Ornstein-Uhlenbeck Mean Reversion
strategies.summary: Trade based on OU process parameter estimation and half-life.
strategies.description: Models price as an Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process and trades when price deviates from estimated long-term mean. Uses half-life to filter for tradeable mean-reversion speed.

Entry: Buy when z < -Entry_Std and halflife in valid range
Risk controls: Only trade when half-life between 1-30 days

notes: Based on OU stochastic differential equation: dX = theta*(mu-X)*dt + sigma*dW
Half-life provides guidance on expected holding period

strategies.name: SPY-GLD Pair
strategies.summary: Mean-revert the SPY/GLD spread using z-score.
strategies.description: Pairs trading on SPY and GLD with a 60-day spread z-score.

strategies.name: Parabolic SAR
strategies.summary: Stop-and-reverse trend system with acceleration.
strategies.description: Tracks a parabolic stop that flips direction on cross.
notes: Long-only by default; set allow_short to enable shorts.

strategies.name: Regime Switch
strategies.summary: Switch between trend and cash based on volatility regime.
strategies.description: Combines long-term trend filter with volatility regime detection.

Entry: Go long when price > SMA and vol < threshold
Exit: Exit when price < SMA or vol > threshold

strategies.name: Residual Momentum
strategies.summary: Trade momentum after removing market factor exposure.
strategies.description: Based on Blitz et al. (2011). Calculates momentum from residual returns after regressing out market factor (SPY). Captures 'pure' idiosyncratic momentum rather than beta-driven returns.

Risk controls: Skip most recent month to avoid reversal

notes: Based on Blitz, Huij & Martens (2011) research
Removes systematic risk, captures idiosyncratic momentum
Uses simplified CAPM residual (SPY as market proxy)

strategies.name: Risk-On/Risk-Off Switch
strategies.summary: Switch between risk and safe-haven assets.
strategies.description: Constructs a composite risk sentiment indicator from multiple signals (volatility, momentum, correlation). Risk-On regime favors equities and commodities. Risk-Off regime shifts to gold and reduces exposure. Dynamic allocation based on regime probability.

Entry: Risk-On: SPY trend up + low vol
Risk-Off: SPY trend down + high vol

notes: Safe haven allocation protects in crises

strategies.name: Risk Parity
strategies.summary: Equal risk contribution from each asset.
strategies.description: Risk Parity allocates weights so each asset contributes equally to total portfolio risk. Uses inverse volatility as a simple approximation, with optional covariance adjustment.
notes: Classic risk parity uses inverse volatility
More sophisticated versions use covariance matrix

strategies.name: RSI Mean Reversion
strategies.summary: Buy oversold and fade overbought with a volatility cap.
strategies.description: A short-term mean reversion model using RSI with volatility gating.

Entry: Buy when RSI < 30 and volatility < threshold

strategies.name: Monthly Seasonality
strategies.summary: Sell in May? Long Nov-Apr, cash May-Oct.
strategies.description: Seasonal timing strategy based on the Nov-Apr effect.
notes: Seasonality pattern applied to SPY only.

strategies.name: Stochastic Oscillator Reversion
strategies.summary: Buy oversold stochastic, exit at neutral.
strategies.description: Uses Stochastic Oscillator (%K and %D) to identify oversold conditions. Enter long when %K drops below 20, exit when rising above 50. Classic oscillator mean reversion.
notes: Measures momentum relative to price range

strategies.name: Stop Loss Overlay
strategies.summary: Universal stop loss with cooldown period.
strategies.description: Overlays a stop loss on a base trend strategy. When price drops below entry by stop percentage, exit and wait for cooldown period before re-entering. Protects gains and limits losses.
notes: Stop loss is essential risk management
Can be overlaid on any strategy

strategies.name: Supertrend
strategies.summary: ATR-based trailing trend system.
strategies.description: Supertrend flips direction when price crosses the ATR band.

Entry: Price breaks above upper band: go long
Price breaks below lower band: exit

notes: Long-only by default; set allow_short to enable shorts.

strategies.name: Time-Series Momentum
strategies.summary: Stay long when 12-month momentum is positive.
strategies.description: A simple time-series momentum model with monthly rebalancing.

strategies.name: Trailing Stop Strategy
strategies.summary: ATR-based trailing stop locks in profits.
strategies.description: Uses ATR-based trailing stop that follows price higher. Stop is set at highest high minus ATR multiplier. Locks in gains during uptrends while allowing room for normal volatility.

Exit: Price < Trailing Stop (Highest High - ATR * Mult)

notes: Stop only moves up, never down
Captures big moves while protecting profits

strategies.name: Trend + Macro Filter
strategies.summary: Trend following with a macro event blackout.
strategies.description: Dual moving average trend with trading disabled near macro events.
notes: Event filter uses first 3 business days of each month as proxy.

strategies.name: Trend + Mean Reversion Hybrid
strategies.summary: Follow trend, buy pullbacks.
strategies.description: Combines trend following with mean reversion. First confirms long-term trend direction, then enters on short-term oversold pullbacks within that trend. Captures trend moves at better entry points.

Risk controls: Only trade in direction of trend

notes: Buy the dip in an uptrend
Trend filter prevents fighting the market
Better entries than pure trend following

strategies.name: Turn of Month
strategies.summary: Hold around month-end and month-start.
strategies.description: Turn of Month effect: stocks tend to perform better around month boundaries. Hold during last N days of month and first M days of next month. Cash otherwise.

Entry: Hold last 3 trading days of month
Hold first 3 trading days of new month

strategies.name: Turtle Trading
strategies.summary: Classic breakout system with trailing exit.
strategies.description: A long-only Turtle Trading system using a 20-day breakout entry and 10-day low exit.

Entry: Go long when close > prior 20-day high

strategies.name: Volatility Breakout
strategies.summary: Enter on large volatility bursts and exit on mean reversion.
strategies.description: Captures volatility expansion while cutting exposure on reversal bars.

strategies.name: Volatility Regime Strategy
strategies.summary: Switch strategy style based on volatility regime.
strategies.description: Dynamically switches between trend following in low volatility regimes and mean reversion in high volatility regimes. Low vol environments favor trends; high vol environments favor mean reversion as prices overshoot.

strategies.name: Volatility Regime Switch
strategies.summary: Adapt position size to volatility regime.
strategies.description: Identifies volatility regimes using historical percentiles. Low volatility regime = full position, high volatility regime = reduced or zero position. Protects capital during turbulent periods.

Entry: Vol percentile < 50 (low vol regime): full position

strategies.name: Volatility Risk Premium
strategies.summary: Harvest volatility risk premium when VRP is high.
strategies.description: Volatility Risk Premium (VRP) is the difference between implied and realized volatility. When VRP is high (implied > realized), sell volatility by holding the underlying. When VRP is negative, stay out as markets may be turbulent.

Indicators: Implied Vol proxy = Recent vol range

notes: VRP is typically positive (variance risk premium)
High VRP = market calm, good to hold

strategies.name: Volatility Target
strategies.summary: Scale exposure to hit a 10% vol target.
strategies.description: Target volatility overlay with a leverage cap.
notes: Applies a volatility targeting overlay to each asset.

strategies.name: 52-Week High Momentum
strategies.summary: Buy when price approaches 52-week high, exit on weakness.
strategies.description: Based on George & Hwang (2004) research. Stocks near their 52-week highs tend to outperform due to investor underreaction (anchoring bias). Enter when price reaches 95% of 52-week high, exit when falling below 85%.

Risk controls: Exit on significant pullback from high

notes: Anchoring bias: investors underreact to prices near historical highs

strategies.name: Williams %R Reversion
strategies.summary: Buy oversold Williams %R, exit at neutral.
strategies.description: Uses Williams %R oscillator to identify oversold conditions. %R ranges from -100 to 0. Enter long when %R < -80 (oversold), exit when %R > -20 (overbought). Classic momentum oscillator reversion.
notes: Similar to Stochastic but inverted scale

strategies.name: Z-Score Mean Reversion
strategies.summary: Simple z-score reversion with volatility and trend filters.
strategies.description: Basic mean reversion using price z-score with dual filters: volatility must be in reasonable range and price must be near 200-day MA (no strong trend). Trades only when conditions favor mean reversion.
notes: Works best when market lacks strong directional bias
